gameplay.map
Class Map

java.lang.Object
  gameplay.map.Map
All Implemented Interfaces:
logging.Loggable
public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
implements logging.Loggable

Overview

The Map class is a Singleton, it has information about positions of cells and dinosaurs playing.
It manage and checks all the movements of dinosaurs.
The map can be generated randomly complying with the given specifications.
The data stored by the Map class can be loaded and saved in a file.
The Map class has information about:

  • Its logger
  • Its creation status
  • Its unique instance
  • Cells composing the map
  • Its dimension

Responsibilities

The class map is responsible for the creation of the gameplay map and movements management.
It manages all the placements of objects such as dinosaurs, cells and food

Collaborators

Vector2D, Position, GraphMap, MapData, Cell Food

Version:
1.1
Author:
AXXO

createRandomMap

public void createRandomMap()
The method createRandomMap creates a new random map which respects the following parameters:
  • Terrain occupies 80% of the entire map, water the remaining 20%
  • The map is not partitioned, every terrain cell can be reached from any other terrain cell
  • The map is an island so it must be surrounded by water cells
  • Water cells inside the map must be in groups of a minimum of 5 and a maximum of 15 cells
  • Vegetation cells must occupy 40% of all terrain cells
  • The map must contain 20 carrions

See Also:
Vector2D, Position, Cell, Food, MapData

validateMap

private void validateMap(Cell[][] theGrid)
                  throws exceptions.InvalidMapException,
                         java.lang.NullPointerException
The method validateMap checks whether the given grid of cells is valid or not. The validation criteria:
  • Terrain occupies 80% of the entire map, water the remaining 20%
  • The map is not partitioned, every terrain cell can be reached from any other terrain cell
  • The map is an island so it must be surrounded by water cells
  • Water cells inside the map must be in groups of a minimum of 5 and a maximum of 15 cells
  • Vegetation cells must occupy 40% of all terrain cells
  • The map must contain 20 carrions

Parameters:
theGrid - to be validated
Throws:
exceptions.InvalidMapException - if the map given as parameter does not comply with the specifications
java.lang.NullPointerException - if theGrid is null

placeDinosaur

public void placeDinosaur(Dinosaur theDinosaur,
                          util.Position thePosition)
                   throws exceptions.InvalidPositionException,
                          exceptions.NotFoundException
The method placeDinosaur places the specified dinosaur in the specified position of the map.
After checking if the dinosaur and the position are valid
It removes the dinosaur from its cell
It assigns the new position to the dinosaur
It puts the dinosaur in the cell present at the given position

Parameters:
theDinosaur - to be placed
thePosition - the position where the dinosaur will be placed
Throws:
exceptions.InvalidPositionException - if the position given as parameter is not valid
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the dinosaur given as parameter is null
exceptions.NotFoundException

placeCarrionRandomly

public void placeCarrionRandomly()
The method placeCarrionRandomly place 20 carrions randomly in the map.
After getting a list of available cells it chooses randomly 20 of them and assigns the carrions to them

placeDinosaurRandomly

public void placeDinosaurRandomly(Dinosaur theDinosaur)
The method placeDinosaurRandomly places a dinosaur randomly onto one of the available cells
It creates a list of available cells then chooses randomly one of them

Parameters:
theDinosaur - to be moved

placeDinosaurRandomly

public void placeDinosaurRandomly(Dinosaur theNewBorn,
                                  Dinosaur theParentDinosaur)
It places a new born dinosaur randomly onto one of the cells nearest to the parent.
It creates a list of the available cells nearest to the parent then chooses randomly one of them

Parameters:
theNewBorn - the new born dinosaur to be placed
theParentDinosaur - the parent of the new born dinaosaur

removeDinosaur

                    throws java.lang.NullPointerException
The method removeDinosaur removes the specified Dinosaur from the map

Parameters:

Throws:

moveDinosaur

public void moveDinosaur(Dinosaur theDinosaur,
                         util.Position theFinalPosition)
                  throws exceptions.InvalidPositionException,
                         exceptions.InvalidDestinationException,
                         exceptions.AlreadyOccupiedCellException,
                         exceptions.StarvationDeathException
The method moveDinosaur moves a dinosaur to a new position if that is possible
This method is invokated by Game#moveDinosaur(Dinosaur, Position) and all exceptions are redirected to that method
It uses GraphMap#calculateShortestPath(Cell, Cell) to calculate the shortest path
It substracts the energy required for the movement to the dinosaur
If the destination contains food edible by the dinosaur, the dinosaur gains energy which is substracted from the food energy
Finally it invokes #placeDinosaur(Dinosaur, Position) to place the dinosaur

Parameters:
the - dinosaur to be moved
theFinalPosition - of the destination
Throws:
exceptions.InvalidPositionException - if the position of the dinosaur is not valid
exceptions.InvalidDestinationException - if the destination given as parameter is not valid
exceptions.AlreadyOccupiedCellException - if there is another dinosaur in the destination cell
exceptions.StarvationDeathException - if the dinosaur died because he hadn't enough energy to finish the movement
See Also:
Game, GraphMap

validatePosition

public boolean validatePosition(util.Position thePosition)
The method validatePosition checks whether the given position is valid or not
It checks if the position is contained in the map

Parameters:
thePosition - to be validated
Returns:
true if the position given as parameter is valid

Parameters:

Returns:
the string containing the symbols representing the information of the cells present in the dinosaur's FOV

getMainMap

public java.lang.String getMainMap(Player thePlayer)
The method getMainMap creates the string containing the characters representing the type of the map cells discovered by the player
It uses Species#getFOV() to get the cells present in the field of view of the species owned by a player

Parameters:
thePlayer - owning the species
Returns:
the string containing the the symbols representing the content of the cells present in the species FOV
See Also:
Dinosaur
